name: Hoddeok
description: A popular Korean street food, these sweet pancakes are filled with a brown sugar, cinnamon, and nut mixture, typically eaten during the winter.
steps: Prepare the dough with flour, sugar, milk, and yeast. Let it rise until doubled in size.
Mix brown sugar, chopped nuts, and cinnamon for the filling.
Divide the dough into balls, flatten them, and place a spoonful of filling in the center.
Seal the dough around the filling and flatten into a pancake shape.
Fry each pancake in a lightly oiled pan until golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot, allowing the syrupy filling to ooze out when bitten.
tips: Ensure the filling is not too close to the edges of the dough to prevent leaking.
Serve immediately for the best taste experience as the filling is deliciously gooey when hot.
Adjust the amount of sugar in the dough and filling based on your sweetness preference.
